text: Pitjantjatjara ( or ) is one of the Western Desert languages of Australia. It is often considered a dialect. It is spoken by the Pitjantjatjara people of central Australia. It is mutually intelligible with other languages of the Western Desert and is very closely related to the Yankunytjatjara language. The name of the people comes from their word for coming/going: . ==References== ==Other websites== *Ethnologue *Languages and dialects associated with Uluru Category:Languages Language
title: Pitjantjatjara language
